skills.name: Recognise the notation for parallel lines
Understand key loci terms like equidistant and perpendicular

explanations.A: These lines do look an equal length in the picture, but the arrows do not mean that they are equal. What does this specfic notation mean?
explanations.B: Arrow symbols on a pair of lines like this mean that they are parallel (going in the same direction).
explanations.C: Perpendicular means that they meet at right angles – do these lines look like they meet at right angles?
explanations.D: Horizontal means the lines would be straight across the page from left to right – do these lines look like that?

explanations.A: Perpendicular means that they meet at right angles – do the lines with arrows on look like they meet at right angles?
explanations.B: Vertical means the lines would go straight up and down – do these lines look like that?
explanations.C: The two marked lines are not an equal length - what do the arrow symbols mean?
explanations.D: Arrow symbols on a pair of lines like this mean that they are parallel (going in the same direction).

explanations.A: I think you have said the lines are parallel as they do not cross in the diagram. However, they will cross at some point if drawn longer. Perpendicular lines meet at a right angle. Is that the case for these lines?
explanations.B: Perpendicular lines meet at 90°. That isn't true for these lines. Are they parallel? They would stay the same distance apart forever if so.
explanations.C: Parallel lines stay the same distance apart forever. Perpendicular lines meet at 90°. Are either of these true for this diagram?
explanations.D: Lines are parallel if they have the same slope and therefore never meet. We use arrows to indicate lines are parallel. Perpendicular means two lines meet at right angles to each other, a small square at the point of intersection would tell us that lines meet at 90° . As we cannot see arrows or a small square both Tom and Katie are incorrect. The dashes on these lines tell us they are equal in length.

explanations.A: Tom is correct as the dash symbol means that the lines are of equal length. Perpendicular means two lines meet at right angles to each other, a small square at the point of intersection would tell us that lines meet at 90°. As this cannot be seen on the diagram Katie is incorrect.
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember perpendicular means the lines intersect at an angle of 90°. Can we tell what angle these lines intersect at? How can we tell if lines are equal in length?
explanations.C: Not quite. Remember two lines are perpendicular if they meet at 90°. Can we tell what angles these lines intersect at?
explanations.D: Not quite, at least one of the students is correct. Look at the diagram, do thes dashes mean the lines are equal in length or that they are perpendicular, meet at 90°?
